main event: An unidentified flying object sighting involving a bright orange light observed in Aiken, South Carolina on December 29, 1967.
interesting points: The observer initially saw the bright orange light at about 30 degrees elevation in the east,The sighting lasted for approximately six minutes,The object suddenly disappeared from view,The observer described the object as round and pulsating, and claimed it to be much larger than a star,The report indicated that no photographs were received despite claims of having pictures taken.
witness description: Officer D. T. Marchant and Sgt. Max A. Meek from the Department of Police
